    • Constructor Detail

      • AttachmentsController

        AttachmentsController​(AttachmentsRepository attachmentsRepository,
                      TokenRepository tokenRepository,
                      EventRepository eventRepository,
                      UserRepository userRepository)
        using constructor injection (Dependency injection) meaning this constructor is typically not used manually.
        Parameters:
        attachmentsRepository - Repository that holds all attachments (injected)
        tokenRepository - Repository that holds all tokens of currently active Users (injected)
        eventRepository - Repository that holds all events (injected)
        userRepository - Repository that holds all registered Users (injected)

    • Method Detail

      • getInfoByEvent

        @GetMapping("/attachments/eventId={eventId}")
java.util.List<AttachmentsInfoDTO> getInfoByEvent​(@PathVariable
                                                  java.lang.Long eventId,
                                                  @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                  java.lang.Long userId,
                                                  @RequestHeader("token")
                                                  java.lang.String token)
                                           throws NoAuthorizationException
        Lists infos on the attachments of the event
        Parameters:
        eventId - id of the event you want to get the info from
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        infos(id, name) of the attachments associated with the event
        Throws:
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails

      • upload

        @PostMapping("/attachments/eventId={eventId}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> upload​(@PathVariable
                                                                 java.lang.Long eventId,
                                                                 java.io.InputStream file,
                                                                 @RequestHeader("fileName")
                                                                 java.lang.String name,
                                                                 @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                                 java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                 @RequestHeader("token")
                                                                 java.lang.String token)
                                                          throws NoAuthorizationException,
                                                                 UploadFailedException,
                                                                 java.io.IOException
        Uploads a file to the database
        Parameters:
        eventId - id of the event you want to add an attachment to
        file - File of unspecified type that is to be saved in the database
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        Http response if the upload was successful
        Throws:
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails
        UploadFailedException - if the file could not be saved
        java.io.IOException

      • download

        @GetMapping("/attachments/id={id}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> download​(@PathVariable
                                                         java.lang.Long id,
                                                         @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                         java.lang.Long userId,
                                                         @RequestHeader("token")
                                                         java.lang.String token)
                                                  throws NoAuthorizationException,
                                                         AttachmentNotFoundException
        Lets the client download an attachment
        Parameters:
        id - of the attachment you want to download to
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        the attachment as a byte array resource and a header that holds its info
        Throws:
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails
        AttachmentNotFoundException - if an attachment with the given id is not found

      • delete

        @DeleteMapping("/attachments/id={id}")
org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> delete​(@PathVariable
                                                                 java.lang.Long id,
                                                                 @RequestHeader("userId")
                                                                 java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                 @RequestHeader("token")
                                                                 java.lang.String token)
                                                          throws NoAuthorizationException,
                                                                 AttachmentNotFoundException
        Delete an attachment
        Parameters:
        id - of the attachment you want to delete
        userId - header that holds the requesting users id
        token - header that holds the requesting users auth token
        Returns:
        if deletion was successful
        Throws:
        NoAuthorizationException - if user authentication fails
        AttachmentNotFoundException - if an attachment with the given id is not found

      • validateParticipants

        boolean validateParticipants​(java.lang.Long eventId,
                             java.lang.Long userId,
                             java.lang.String token)
        Validates User to grant them access to Attachments, based on his admin role or his participation in the attachment is associated to
        Parameters:
        eventId - of the event that the client wants to access
        userId - of the requesting user
        token - of the requesting user, used to validate his login status
        Returns:
        true if the given userId and token match a tokenEntity in the database and the accessing user is accessing an event he is participating or is an admin, false otherwise;
